item.title: If We Don’t Flip Some Toss-Up States, Romney, Ryan, and the USA Are Screwed
item.description: Choosing Paul Ryan as his running mate was a great Romney move. Looking ahead, Romney sees movement conservatives working hard right up to the election—even if he or his advisors continues to say stupid things. That was necessary. SCROLL DOWN FOR TWO IMPORTANT EVENTS THIS WEEK But it wasn’t enough to win the election and unseat America’s first anti-American president. To do that, we must find a way to win over the selfish middle.

item.title: If the election were held today, there’d be a lot of crying and gnashing of teeth
item.description:
Here’s a screen grab from RealClearPolitics.com’s presidential tracking poll:
RCP aggregates dozens of polls to produce its RCP average. The method has been remarkably accurate, especially at the state level. It’s time to focus on preventing the unmitigated disaster of a second Obama term. In 112 days, Americans will vote on whether or not to continue our experiment in self-government. If the election were held today, that experiment would be aborted.
